title: Prerendered pages with trailing slash 404 when directly loaded

milestone.description: stuff we need to nail down before launch

body: ### Describe the bug This only appears to happen when deployed (I've tested Vercel, but not other deployment options) and works as expected with a local `npm run build && npm run preview`. With `export const prerender = true;` in `src/routes/+layout.ts` and `trailingSlash: "always"` in the config, rendered pages 404 when directly loaded. The page loads as expected when navigating from another page (i.e. client-side navigation), but when loaded directly (or when the link is clicked before code implementing client-side navigation is loaded), the URL returns a 404. This isn't a problem with `trailingSlash: "never"`. ### Reproduction ### `trailingSlash: "always"` - [Demo](https://repro-prerender-404-k64onxso1-drzax.vercel.app/) - [Code](https://github.com/drzax/repro-prerender-404) There's a PR in that repo where the only change is to set `trailingSlash: "never"`: - [Demo](https://repro-prerender-404-6hgfib8uc-drzax.vercel.app/) - [Code](https://github.com/drzax/repro-prerender-404/pull/1/files) This doesn't appear to affect the root path (presumably because it always has a trailing slash), but all other paths appear to be affected. ### Logs _No response_ ### System Info ```Shell System: OS: macOS 12.6 CPU: (16) x64 Intel(R) Core(TM) i9-9880H CPU @ 2.30GHz Memory: 51.70 MB / 32.00 GB Shell: 5.1.8 - /usr/local/bin/bash Binaries: Node: 18.8.0 - /usr/local/bin/node npm: 8.19.2 - /usr/local/bin/npm Browsers: Chrome: 109.0.5414.10 Edge: 107.0.1418.52 Firefox: 106.0.5 Firefox Developer Edition: 107.0 Safari: 16.0 npmPackages: @sveltejs/adapter-auto: next => 1.0.0-next.88 @sveltejs/adapter-vercel: ^1.0.0-next.81 => 1.0.0-next.81 @sveltejs/kit: next => 1.0.0-next.551 svelte: ^3.44.0 => 3.53.1 vite: ^3.1.0 => 3.2.4 ``` ### Severity serious, but I can work around it ### Additional Information In my use case I can set trailingSlash to 'never', but can easily imagine a scenario where that might not be possible or desirable. Vercel build output where trailing slash is 'always' Vercel build output where trailing slash is 'never' This may be related to (or even the same bug as) #6236, but I couldn't tell for sure so thought I'd submit this anyway â€” apologies if it's a duplicate.
